review_text:
[u]This review was written in English and Russian in purpose to save your money and time.[/u]

â€œUnhappy Ever Afterâ€ is a RPG in a grim fairy world where well-known tales and characters (Alice, HĞµnsel and Gretel, Little Red Riding Hood, etc.) were twisted by wicked minds of developers from Warped Tales. Beyond its parody to the fantasy â€œUnhappy Ever Afterâ€ also aims to parody the real world drawing on situations that are all too prevalent in our society such as drug abuse, terrorism, and dirty politics. 

â€œUnhappy Ever Afterâ€ takes place in a dark fantasy land of Twelve Duchies where Emperorâ€™s dictatorship is issued for legitimate power and magesâ€™ resistance is called terrorism.

Iâ€™d rather say itâ€™s a mature story that provides a unique perspective on childrenâ€™s tales while addressing the difficult issues that plague modern society. I really liked the main story and the Twelve Duchiesâ€™ background written with subtle humor and usage such adult themes like cannibalism, vengeance, death, substance abuse.


Visually â€œUnhappy Ever Afterâ€ is pretty impressive for a RPG Maker game. Gameâ€™s graphics and art style are very nice and immersive. 
To my surprise developers did their best designing each area of the world beautiful looking (for a RPG Maker game). They tried to make each region (location) is unique and visually unlike other regions. Besides thereâ€™re different monsters in each region and every region has its own story and side-quests. 

Sure thereâ€™re some problems in the game. Although the music is pretty good the sounds are repeating and annoying. Thereâ€™s no load option in the menu and no in-game map. The developers didnâ€™t hire any proof-readers so thereâ€™re some typos, misspelling and wrong itemsâ€™ descriptions in the game. Every player can see glitches and bugs in the game (e.g. walking through walls, unreachable chests, unequipable items).

But the primary reason for me finally giving up the game after such a long time playing this game (over 8 hours) was a high rate of random encounters (battles with monsters unseen in the screen). ARGH! I couldnâ€™t walk a few steps without starting a random battle! Random battles were [u]every 15-20 seconds[/u] while traveling outside town!
And to double my frustration the enemies were auto-leveling up with my partyâ€™s level.

The game really needs a lot of polishing but for unknown reasons developers stopped communication with the community and correction the game in February, 2017.

[u]This is a warped tale about â€œUnhappy Ever Afterâ€ became an abandonware.[/u]
 
______________________________________________________________

name: Unhappy Ever After
tags: Adventure, Indie, RPG, RPGMaker, Dark Fantasy
review_text_clean:
This review was written in English and Russian in purpose to save your money and time. 

â€œUnhappy Ever Afterâ€ is a RPG in a grim fairy world where well-known tales and characters (Alice, HĞµnsel and Gretel, Little Red Riding Hood, etc.) were twisted by wicked minds of developers from Warped Tales. Beyond its parody to the fantasy â€œUnhappy Ever Afterâ€ also aims to parody the real world drawing on situations that are all too prevalent in our society such as drug abuse, terrorism, and dirty politics. 

â€œUnhappy Ever Afterâ€ takes place in a dark fantasy land of Twelve Duchies where Emperorâ€™s dictatorship is issued for legitimate power and magesâ€™ resistance is called terrorism.

Iâ€™d rather say itâ€™s a mature story that provides a unique perspective on childrenâ€™s tales while addressing the difficult issues that plague modern society. I really liked the main story and the Twelve Duchiesâ€™ background written with subtle humor and usage such adult themes like cannibalism, vengeance, death, substance abuse.


Visually â€œUnhappy Ever Afterâ€ is pretty impressive for a RPG Maker game. Gameâ€™s graphics and art style are very nice and immersive. 
To my surprise developers did their best designing each area of the world beautiful looking (for a RPG Maker game). They tried to make each region (location) is unique and visually unlike other regions. Besides thereâ€™re different monsters in each region and every region has its own story and side-quests. 

Sure thereâ€™re some problems in the game. Although the music is pretty good the sounds are repeating and annoying. Thereâ€™s no load option in the menu and no in-game map. The developers didnâ€™t hire any proof-readers so thereâ€™re some typos, misspelling and wrong itemsâ€™ descriptions in the game. Every player can see glitches and bugs in the game (e.g. walking through walls, unreachable chests, unequipable items).

But the primary reason for me finally giving up the game after such a long time playing this game (over 8 hours) was a high rate of random encounters (battles with monsters unseen in the screen). ARGH! I couldnâ€™t walk a few steps without starting a random battle! Random battles were every 15-20 seconds while traveling outside town!
And to double my frustration the enemies were auto-leveling up with my partyâ€™s level.

The game really needs a lot of polishing but for unknown reasons developers stopped communication with the community and correction the game in February, 2017.

 This is a warped tale about â€œUnhappy Ever Afterâ€ became an abandonware.

review_text:
[h1] Information / Review English [/h1]

New Yankee in Santa's Service is a time management game developed by Rionix.

[h1] Gameplay / Story [/h1]

Play New Yankee in Santa's Service, a fun game to enjoy all year round. In the previous game in the hit series, Mary cast a spell to bring herself and her husband home, but instead, Santa's reindeer disappeared. At the festive New Yankee in Santa's Service, use time and resources to find the missing reindeer before Christmas. You collect resources, build buildings, remove obstacles or save various life beings in your adventure.

[h1] Pro [/h1]

+ Colorful animated worlds
+ Soundtrack, desktop backgrounds and other great extras
+ various difficulties, not too easy and not too difficult
+ many levels that offer a good number of hours of game time
+ same game mechanics as in the previous games
+ Trading cards

[h1] Contra [/h1]

- Level design repeats itself over time
- seen everything before in other games

[h1] Conclusion [/h1]

New Yankee in Santa's Service offers you a solid time management game, which stands out from the other parts with a few innovations. But personally I would wait for a sale.


[h1] Information / Review Deutsch [/h1]

New Yankee in Santa's Service ist ein Zeitmanagementspiel, welches von Rionix  entwickelt wurde. 

[h1] Gameplay / Story [/h1]

Spiele New Yankee in Santa's Service, ein lustiges Spiel, das du das ganze Jahr genieÃŸen kannst, Im vorherigen Spiel der Hitserie sprach Mary einen Zauber, um sich und ihren Mann nach Hause zu bringen, aber stattdessen verschwanden Santas Rentiere. Nutze im festlichen New Yankee in Santa's Service Zeit und Ressourcen, um die vermissten Rentiere vor Weihnachten zu finden. Du sammelst Ressourcen, baust GebÃ¤ude, entfernst Hindernisse oder rettest verschiedene Lebenwesen in deinem Abenteuer. 

[h1] Pro [/h1]

+ Farbenfroh animierte Welten
+ Soundtrack, Desktop-HintergrÃ¼nde und weitere tolle Extras 
+ verschiedene Schwierigkeiten, nicht zu leicht und nicht zu schwer
+ viele Level, die eine gute Anzahl von Stunden Spielzeit bieten
+ gleiche Spielmechanik wie bei den vorherigen Spielen
+ Sammelkarten

[h1] Kontra [/h1]

- Leveldesign wiederholt sich mit der Zeit
- alles schon mal gesehen bei anderen Spielen

[h1] Fazit [/h1]

New Yankee in Santa's Service bietet dir ein solides Zeitmanagementspiel, welches auch durch wenige Neuerungen sich von den anderen Teilen abhebt. Ich wÃ¼rde persÃ¶nlich aber auf ein Sale warten.

review_text: Me tomo mas de 140Hs terminar y platinar este juego. Dura 80Hs mas de lo que deveria. Tiene buenas ideas y es un gran exponente del genero, mecanicas muy utiles y la historia (sin ser algo a gran destacar) sostiene la trama y aporta. Pero tiene fallos muy graves como el super exesivo random enconter, la lentitud del traversing, lo innesesariamente gigante de los mapas los dos o tres capitulos finales se hacen eternos y poco aportan a la experiencia. Ya entrando en el cap extra dura como 30 horas mas y esta super mal diseÃ±ado y se glichea constantemente por lo que ahi que salvar literal cada 10 pasos para no perder avanze y la pelea final no recompensa en lo mas minimo. y la revelacion final es un ble (solo para complesionistas obstinados como yo para mi desgracia) Este tipo de juegos me encantan, sobretodo si controlas a personajes reales y no a cosas con cara como en los ethrian, pero es una regla que ESTE tipo de juegos no puede durar mas de 60 o 70 horas por ovios motivos y este juego rompe esa linea de confort con creses
name: Mary Skelter: Nightmares
tags: JRPG, Dungeon Crawler, Anime, Horror, Visual Novel

review_text:
Dentro de su simpleza una muy entrentenida obra. 
Agradable de llevar y muy rico en su expresion sobre la era y la cultura del Tango. Muy llevable para personas completamente ajenas al entorno de los malevos y las milongas, no deja de mandarle un guiÃ±o de cariÃ±o a grandes aventuras graficas que claramente marcaron a los desarrolladores.

Lo unico que le puedo reprochar es que faltan las voces (audio) en los dialogos y las "pantallas de carga" que si bien no tardan nada hacen medio pastosa la transicion entre escenarios.
name: Tango: The Adventure Game
tags: Adventure, Indie, Point & Click, Story Rich, Cartoony

review_text:
Ich habe mich nach all den Jahren entschlossen mich mal wieder an GÃ¶tterdÃ¤mmerung zu wagen, ein Spiel welches damals als lÃ¤cherliche Beleidigung fÃ¼r die Gothic Community galt, voll mit bugs und anderen Problemen. Habe es mir jetzt mal im Angebot fÃ¼r 2,49 EUR besorgt und tatsÃ¤chlich eine relativ "gute" Spielzeit damit verbracht. Ich habe das Spiel komplett cheatfrei durchgespielt und mir eine menge Zeit dabei genommen, allerdings nicht 100% aller Quests beendet. Vorab; ich wusste worauf ich mich da einlasse, da ich das Spiel vor zig Jahren einige male angespielt hatte und auch einfach noch ein bisschen Zeit in der grandiosen Welt von G3 verbringen wollte ohne ein auswendig gelerntes Spiel wieder anzufassen.
Die Story ist kein offizieller kanon und daher widme ich ihr keine groÃŸe Aufmerksamkeit. Ich muss allerdings sagen dass sie mir im groben(!) tatsÃ¤chlich ganz gut gefallen hat. An sich Ã¼berhaupt eine Hauptstory zu haben ist mal was anderes im Vergleich zum Ã¼blichen non-linearen open world feeling von G3. Viele Quests waren schlicht bescheuert und sinnlos. Besonders die beiden Questreihen der TorwÃ¤chter von Gotha und Vengard. Hat schon meme potenzial. Die zweite HÃ¤lfte des Spiels hat mir da schon besser gefallen und ein bisschen diversitÃ¤t in das questen reingebracht. Ãœber schlechtes coding und unbefriedigende Dialoge kann das allerdings nicht hinwegtÃ¤uschen. Wenigstens sind die deutschen Synchronsprecher dieselben soweit ich das erfasst habe und der Protagonist haut auch ein paar heftige SprÃ¼che raus, abseits von "Es werden VerÃ¤nderungen kommen" und "Ich bin ein BÃ¼rger Myrtanas" - das kommt einem echt aus den Ohren wieder raus.
Ich musste einige male Google verwenden um diverse NPCs zu finden die in Dialogen bezÃ¼glich des Standorts absolut nicht erÃ¶rtert wurden, wenn man GlÃ¼ck hat steht mehr im Tagebuch aber sonst heisst es frei Schnauze suchen und finden, oder eben googlen. Da hÃ¤tte man sich mehr MÃ¼he geben kÃ¶nnen und mÃ¼ssen. Was mir ansonsten auch positiv aufgefallen ist sind neue RÃ¼stungen und Waffen die sowohl hÃ¼bsch anzusehen als auch nÃ¼tzlich sind. Das Balancing ist allerdings ziemlich off, leveln geht absurd schnell dank komplett Ã¼bertriebenen xp rewards fÃ¼r Quests. Muss allerdings dazu sagen dass der Endboss auch kein Sahneschleck ist.

Gothic 3 GÃ¶tterdÃ¤mmerung oder Forsaken Gods ist ein durchschnittliches RPG welches nach lÃ¤ngerer Zeit des aufarbeitens tatsÃ¤chlich komplett bugfrei ist. Es bietet kein Vergleich zur Ã¼blichen QualitÃ¤t der Gothic und Risen Reihe und ich empfehle den Kauf nur wenn man ein gutes Bild davon hat was einen hier erwartet- sonst rennt man schlicht vor eine Wand der EnttÃ¤uschung.
Hatte generell aber ein ganz interessantes Spielerlebnis und daher gibts den Daumen hoch von mir.

review_text:
Pretty Nice Puzzle Game. Without any discount a little bit expensieve but the developer made a good job to create an addiction puzzle fun factor. 
With achievements and trading cards to collect the prize is okay (Summer Sale Action)

Bei Puzzlespielen bin ich immer skeptisch. Meistens langweilt es mich nach 1 Stunde wenn sich kein guter Suchtfaktor einstellt (z.B. leicht erreichbare Errungenschaften oder leicht durchzuspielene Levels)
Bei dem Spiel ist es nicht so. Gute Sounduntermalung und schlampigkeitsfehler werden mit dem Nichterreichen der Errungenschaften (Fehlerfrei 0-1) bestraft.
Der Vollpreis ist etwas zu teuer angesetzt aber dennoch zahlt es sich aus. Die Entwickler haben keine MÃ¼hen gescheut das Spiel gut umzusetzten. :-)

review_text:
[h1] Information / Review English [/h1]

Disney Universe is an Adventure / Family game developed by Eurocom.

[h1] Gameplay / Story [/h1]

In a virtual Amusement Park that reminds Film buffs of a Disneyized version of Westworld, an evil AI has taken Control of the Computer systems and trapped some of the Guests in the six themed Worlds. You now have to fight your way through three manageable Sections and finally defeat a Boss in order to free the Guest trapped there and thus unlock his Costume. In total, there are over 40 Panels that can be unlocked and put on, but which would be upgraded if they were also different Functions or strengths or weaknesses such as close-range or long-Range combat. But in the End all the Characters play largely identically, so that a great chance is wasted here to do something for a higher replay Value or even increased tactical understanding in the team Selection. Up to four Players can be up to mischief in the sections based on Disney films.

[h1] Pro [/h1]

+ nice Art design in a Comic look
+ Character with lots of Charm
+ famous Disney characters
+ Child-friendly
+ many tasks
+ Mini-games
+ good Soundtrack
+ numerous unlockable Bonus material
+ Trading cards

[h1] Contra [/h1]

- Tasks repeat themselves over time
- Keyboard controls not implemented well

[h1] Conclusion [/h1]

Disney Universe offers you a wonderful Amusement park, which has many Options and invites you to Explore. Clear buy recommendation.


[h1] Information / Review Deutsch [/h1]

Disney Universe ist ein Abenteuer/Familien-Spiel, welches von Eurocom entwickelt wurde. 

[h1] Gameplay / Geschichte [/h1]

In einem virtuellen VergnÃ¼gungspark, der Filmkenner an eine disneyisierte Variante der Westworld erinnert, hat eine bÃ¶se KI die Kontrolle Ã¼ber die Computersysteme Ã¼bernommen und einige der GÃ¤ste in den sechs Themenwelten gefangen.
Man muss sich nun durch jeweils drei Ã¼berschaubare Abschnitte kÃ¤mpfen und schlieÃŸlich einen Boss besiegen, um den dort gefangenen Gast zu befreien und damit sein KostÃ¼m freizuschalten. Insgesamt gibt es Ã¼ber 40 Verkleidungen, die man freischalten und anziehen kann, die jedoch dadurch aufgewertet wÃ¼rden, wenn sie auch noch unterschiedliche
Funktionen oder StÃ¤rken bzw. SchwÃ¤chen wie z.B. Nah- oder Fernkampf hÃ¤tten. Doch letztlich spielen sich alle Figuren weitgehend identisch, so dass hier eine groÃŸe Chance vertan wird, etwas fÃ¼r einen gehobenen Wiederspielwert oder gar erhÃ¶htes taktisches VerstÃ¤ndnis bei der Teamauswahl zu tun. Bis zu vier Spieler kÃ¶nnen in den an Disney-Filme angelehnten Abschnitten ihr Unwesen treiben.

[h1] Pro [/h1]

+ nettes Artdesign im Comic-Look
+ Character mit viel Charme
+ bekannte Disney Figuren
+ kinderfreundlich
+ viele Aufgaben
+ Minispiele
+ guter Soundtrack
+ zahlreiches freischaltbares Bonusmaterial
+ Sammelkarten

[h1] Kontra [/h1]

- Aufgaben wiederholen sich mit der Zeit
- Tastatur-Steuerung nicht gut umgesetzt

[h1] Fazit [/h1]

Disney Universe bietet dir einen wundervollen VergnÃ¼gungspark, welcher dir viele MÃ¶glichkeiten aufweist und zum erkunden einlÃ¤dt. Klare Kaufempfehlung.

review_text:
Vea a continuaciÃ³n la versiÃ³n en espaÃ±ol de esta reseÃ±a.

So you want to be a shadowrunner, but you played all the Dragonfall content? Look no further.

Buy Hong Kong Extended Edition! Extended Edition [b]includes a campaign following the end of the main Hong Kong story.[/b] 

Hong Kong is [b]game crack for laptop users[/b] because it is a turn-based game which can be played offline with minimal resource usage.

Hong Kong is [b]game crack for tabletop RPG players[/b] because they don't have to roll dice or spend hours doing the math; the game does it for you. 

Hong Kong is game crack for anyone who loves dystopian futures or urban fantasy, giving the chance to explore Hong Kong in a magical but dystopian future.

Hong Kong is [b]challenging for modders[/b], as it includes ShadowrunEditor.exe in the folder \Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\Common Files\Hong Kong Extended Edition\ and more advanced changes can be made with Unity development tools.
Two laptops ago, when I tried to create a Fan Mission set in the Phillippines, I used the Editor for HK, and it corrupted my whole project, losing about two months worth of work done in my free time. Make of that what you will. (Yes I'm slow. I was working 60 hour weeks at the time.)


Personnel involved in Hong Kong and Hong Kong Extended Edition include...

- Creative Director Jordan "Zapper" Wiseman, who created the Shadowrun, BattleTech, Renegade Legion, and Earthdawn tabletop RPG universes.
- Many DF developer staff went on to work on the Lamplighters League (2023)


Fan Missions extend replayability of Hong Kong Extended Edition...

Top Notch Fan Missions include:
- [b]Vox Populi[/b] - a small team of fans re-made the Dead Man Switch campaign (Shadowrun Returns, set in Seattle) using the HK Editor.

- royalamphibian's "[b]The Enemy of My Enemy[/b]" - Solo run (almost) in a locked down office building. Rise to the top or get dead. If you wanted to play Judge Dredd in the film Dredd, this is that sort of fan mission.

- cirion's "[b]The Caldecott Caper[/b]" - set in San Francisco Bay area after Antumbra Saga (see Dragonfall Workshop) but before CalFree in Chains. You're a corpsec guard. The company declined your medical claim, so you need to make cash using what you know about the company and some handy mercenaries...

- cirion's "[b]CalFree in Chains[/b]" - Welcome back for one final run in the San Francisco Bay Area Sprawl! This campaign picks up shortly after the end of The Caldecott Caper. Enter, General Saito and the Japanese occupying force in San Francisco... aaand, action!

- molefixer's "[b]Coldplay[/b]" - You wake in a mostly shut down Ares space station in Earth orbit. Irregular melee character build at start. Not sure it's totally tabletop SR canon, but scarily, it COULD be. The timing and ending of the FM setting is eery.


Â¿Quieres ser un shadowrunner, pero ya jugaste todo el contenido de Dragonfall? Â¡No busques mÃ¡s!

Â¡Compra Hong Kong Extended Edition! La EdiciÃ³n Extendida [b]incluye una campaÃ±a tras el final de la historia principal de Hong Kong[/b].

Hong Kong es [b]ideal para usuarios de portÃ¡tiles[/b] porque es un juego por turnos que se puede jugar sin conexiÃ³n con un consumo mÃ­nimo de recursos.

Hong Kong es [b]ideal para jugadores de rol de mesa[/b] porque no tienen que tirar dados ni pasar horas haciendo cÃ¡lculos; el juego lo hace por ti.

Hong Kong es ideal para quienes aman los futuros distÃ³picos o la fantasÃ­a urbana, y ofrece la oportunidad de explorar Hong Kong en un futuro mÃ¡gico pero distÃ³pico.

Hong Kong es un [b]desafÃ­o para los modders[/b], ya que incluye ShadowrunEditor.exe en la carpeta \Archivos de programa (x86)\Steam\steamapps\Archivos comunes\Hong Kong Extended Edition\ y se pueden realizar cambios mÃ¡s avanzados con las herramientas de desarrollo de Unity.
Hace dos portÃ¡tiles, cuando intentÃ© crear una misiÃ³n de fans ambientada en Filipinas, usÃ© el editor de Hong Kong y corrompiÃ³ todo mi proyecto, perdiendo aproximadamente dos meses de trabajo realizado en mi tiempo libre. Interpreten lo que quieran. (SÃ­, soy lento. En aquel entonces trabajaba 60 horas semanales).

El personal involucrado en Hong Kong y Hong Kong Extended Edition incluye a...

- El director creativo Jordan "Zapper" Wiseman, creador de los universos de los juegos de rol de mesa Shadowrun, BattleTech, Renegade Legion y Earthdawn. Muchos desarrolladores de DF trabajaron en la Liga de Lamplighters (2023).

Las misiones de fans amplÃ­an la rejugabilidad de la EdiciÃ³n Extendida de Hong Kong...

Las mejores misiones de fans incluyen:
- [b]Vox Populi[/b]: un pequeÃ±o equipo de fans rehizo la campaÃ±a de Dead Man Switch (Shadowrun Returns, ambientada en Seattle) con el Editor de Hong Kong.

- "[b]El enemigo de mi enemigo[/b]" de royalamphibian: una partida en solitario (casi) en un edificio de oficinas cerrado. Asciende a la cima o muere. Si querÃ­as jugar como el Juez Dredd en la pelÃ­cula Dredd, esta es el tipo de misiÃ³n de fans.

- "[b]El caso de Caldecott[/b]" de cirion: ambientada en la BahÃ­a de San Francisco despuÃ©s de la Saga Antumbra (ver Dragonfall Workshop) pero antes de CalFree in Chains. Eres un guardia cadÃ¡ver. review_text_clean:
Vea a continuaciÃ³n la versiÃ³n en espaÃ±ol de esta reseÃ±a.

So you want to be a shadowrunner, but you played all the Dragonfall content? Look no further.

Buy Hong Kong Extended Edition! Extended Edition includes a campaign following the end of the main Hong Kong story. 

Hong Kong is game crack for laptop users because it is a turn-based game which can be played offline with minimal resource usage.

Hong Kong is game crack for tabletop RPG players because they don't have to roll dice or spend hours doing the math; the game does it for you. 

Hong Kong is game crack for anyone who loves dystopian futures or urban fantasy, giving the chance to explore Hong Kong in a magical but dystopian future.

Hong Kong is challenging for modders , as it includes ShadowrunEditor.exe in the folder \Program Files (x86)\Steam\steamapps\Common Files\Hong Kong Extended Edition\ and more advanced changes can be made with Unity development tools.
Two laptops ago, when I tried to create a Fan Mission set in the Phillippines, I used the Editor for HK, and it corrupted my whole project, losing about two months worth of work done in my free time. Make of that what you will. (Yes I'm slow. I was working 60 hour weeks at the time.)


Personnel involved in Hong Kong and Hong Kong Extended Edition include.

- Creative Director Jordan "Zapper" Wiseman, who created the Shadowrun, BattleTech, Renegade Legion, and Earthdawn tabletop RPG universes.
- Many DF developer staff went on to work on the Lamplighters League (2023)


Fan Missions extend replayability of Hong Kong Extended Edition.

Top Notch Fan Missions include:
- Vox Populi - a small team of fans re-made the Dead Man Switch campaign (Shadowrun Returns, set in Seattle) using the HK Editor.

- royalamphibian's " The Enemy of My Enemy " - Solo run (almost) in a locked down office building. Rise to the top or get dead. If you wanted to play Judge Dredd in the film Dredd, this is that sort of fan mission.

- cirion's " The Caldecott Caper " - set in San Francisco Bay area after Antumbra Saga (see Dragonfall Workshop) but before CalFree in Chains. You're a corpsec guard. The company declined your medical claim, so you need to make cash using what you know about the company and some handy mercenaries.

- cirion's " CalFree in Chains " - Welcome back for one final run in the San Francisco Bay Area Sprawl! This campaign picks up shortly after the end of The Caldecott Caper. Enter, General Saito and the Japanese occupying force in San Francisco. aaand, action!

- molefixer's " Coldplay " - You wake in a mostly shut down Ares space station in Earth orbit. Irregular melee character build at start. Not sure it's totally tabletop SR canon, but scarily, it COULD be. The timing and ending of the FM setting is eery.

Ottima la pixel art, discrete le musiche di accompagnamento e convincente il coloratissimo mondo di gioco. Segnalo positivamente anche l'ottima traduzione in italiano, perchÃ© c'e' molto testo da leggere e rende l'avventura ancora piu' godibile.

Ho terminato il gioco sotto Linux senza avere mai avuto un problema.

review_text:
Teil 3 der Zeitmanagement-Spieleserie ist super gelungen.
Die Levels sind sehr schÃ¶n gezeichnet und abwechslungsreich gestaltet, leider wieder einmal kein HD Modus.
Mir gefÃ¤llt es noch viel besser als Teil 2, denn hier bekommt man erstmals sehr differenzierte und andere Aufgaben als immer nur die 2-3 Standardaufgaben, die man in Teil 2 erledigen muste.
Am liebsten hÃ¤tte ich dieses Spiel in einem Rutsch durchgezockt, so toll ist es.
Erstmals kann man in diesem Teil der Serie die geretteten Menschen in GebÃ¤ude schicken. 
Das bringt 20 Extraressourcen. Dadurch wird das Spiel noch um einiges taktischer.
Auch, weil man nun endlich die GebÃ¤ude mehrmals aufwerten kann.
Man steht also stÃ¤ndig vor der Entscheidung, welches seiner GebÃ¤ude man zuerst aufwerten mÃ¶chte, oder ob man als nÃ¤chstes einen Menschen oder einen Bauarbeiter retten mÃ¶chte. 
Das man einfach richtig viel SpaÃŸ.
Die Story und die schÃ¶nen Karten tun ihr Ã¼briges dazu.
Das Spiel ist Ã¼brigens gerade im Deal.
FÃ¼r das Geld eine absolute Kaufempfehlung!

Sound/Grafik: 7/10
SpielspaÃŸ: 9/10
Gesamtwertung: 8/10

Preis-Leistung: 10/10
The first in the Rescue Team series that tries something new. The graphics have received an overhaul over the previous two titles, the game features a story which can be amusing, but I skipped over it most of the time as I found it a distraction, and the map design has been changed from a pathing system to something more open.

Overall, initially the changes were unwelcome after playing the first two games, but once I got used to the more open world and started clicking through the story, the game still has the major time and resource elements to keep you hooked and trying for those gold results.

Overall, initially the changes were unwelcome after playing the first two games, but once I got used to the more open world and started clicking through the story, the game still has the major time and resource elements to keep you hooked and trying for those gold results.

review_text:
[h1]English[/h1]
SO COOL. Good atmosphere, good dynamics, good customization, and the online game is very immersive. Being able to play and talk to other players online gives you a lot of fun. The bad thing is that you need to unlock levels to gain access to more powerful weapons, and not be so weak against other online users. Also the physics of this game feels broken sometimes, the bots are very easy to win and there are very few online players. Even with all that, I had a great time playing and it's one of those that I'll play more hours. Unfortunately the developers have abandon this game and there are very few players, so make sure to go to the Discord chat to meet some real players that are keeping this game alive!: https://discord.gg/wjkxqHD

review_text: Es juegos jrpg con una historia muy cliche.La mecanica del juego es muy parecida a los juegos de personas, donde para crear mejores 'child' necesita desarollar la historia o dialogar con la distintas heroinas.Sin embargo es un juego un poco sencillo y corto. Recomiendo para aquellos que no puedan comprar algun juego de persona o recien entren al genero.

review_text:
Un gioco che mi sento di consigliare, ma a prezzo ridotto, per via di alcune pecche che ne minano il giudizio globale.

Partiamo dai lati positivi:

+ il gioco ricorda per certi versi Hotline Miami, senza esserne la fotocopia
+ grafica curata
+ musiche ben realizzate
+ ambientazioni varie
+ la caratterizzazione dei personaggi si integra molto bene con l'atmosfera criminale del gioco senza stonare o sembrare fuori luogo
+ ritmo bilanciato tra storia e azione: brevi intermezzi tra una sparatoria e l'altra che non appesantiscono o rallentano
+ la storia non si dilunga inutilmente e non sono presenti parti che sembrano messe solo per allungare il brodo

e ora i lati negativi:

- il gioco e' abbastanza breve e il finale chiude in maniera brusca la storia
- non e' possibile riconfigurare i tasti (non e' la fine del mondo ma avrei preferito avere la possibilita' di farlo)
- la difficolta' non e' bilanciata: non e' frustrante, ma prende alla sprovvista, sopratutto perche' non e' progressiva
- numero di armi e' ridotto: in genere e' disponibile solo la pistola e (piu' avanti nel gioco) la mitragliatrice 
- il sistema che permette di usare i vari oggetti (cestini, casse, auto, etc.) presenti nel livello per ripararsi dai colpi nemici andrebbe migliorato, magari facendo in modo di agganciare automaticamente il personaggio quando si preme il rispettivo pulsante in prossimita' di un oggetto in grado di offrire copertura.
name: Milanoir
genres: Sexual Content, Nudity, Violent, Action, Adventure, Indie
tags: Action, Indie, Adventure, Pixel Graphics, Sexual Content

review_text:
|ENG \ RUS|

Rules tell me to be polite while writing a review for this game, and I'll try. It's very hard to do. This game is what you call PURE EVIL. When you love action RPGs like Titan Quest or Diablo, you go and make something like Path of Exile or Grim Dawn. But when you see those games getting support and want some too while doing especially nothing, you make Iesabel. This game is not just bad. It's one of the worst I played, and from my profile you can see I play a lot. I also had PS1 back there and PS4 now, plus Wii U and 3DS. I never seen such a catastrophy of a game. 

The worst thing in Iesabel is the controls - and I can't explain it, it just feels broken. Your character moves whenever he or she wants, and you cant realize, what's blocking your path, because ground texture is like... I dont want to use the s-word here, but this is perfect analogy. Graphics is unappealing to say the least. Character  progression is broken too - skills are not only stupid, but unbalanced. 

Just do yourself a favour and dont support this kind of lazy "indie" developers. They should be punished, not supported.

***

review_text:
(ENGLISH + SPANISH)

First of all, let's keep in mind that this is a PC port of a game that was originally for mobile devices. And honestly, it's a very good boxing game. Both the career mode and the multiplayer mode are well done, and the best part is that it eliminates microtransactions. Obviously, because weâ€™ve already paid for the game, whereas itâ€™s free on mobile.

Itâ€™s not a super realistic simulation of the sport of boxing, but for what it is, itâ€™s quite entertaining. And the best thing is that you can play with friends, either via crossplay or local play. The joystick controls are way more comfortable than on mobile, which makes it much more enjoyable.

Personally, I had a lot of fun playing career mode and completing it 100%. It's a game that, while it doesn't revolutionize the genre, is very fun to pass the time, especially when playing with friends.

That said, I would have liked them to improve the customization system when creating your character, because, to be honest, it's pretty limited. But aside from that, the other aspects of the game are pretty solid, for what it is.

Buen juego, Buena experiencia, es un juego muy noble, concreto y sin ser pretencioso.
Buena dificultad, te recompensa a medida que avanzas y tambiÃ©n te hace aventar el control hahaha.
Se puede pulir la respuesta de los controles, la historia y el arte (a veces la interacciÃ³n con el mundo no es clara). Pero nada que afecte la experiencia.
Precio justo por lo que juegas, en general Good Stuff!!!

review_text:
Me ha [b]encantado[/b] el juego [b]sobremanera[/b], me ha recordado mucho a la ilusiÃ³n de jugar The Wolf Among Us, sin nada que envidiar.

La jugabilidad muy digna, el sistema de pistas muy bueno, la lÃ³gica detrÃ¡s de las deducciones orgÃ¡nica y fiable. Este juego te hace sentirte verdaderamente detective y entrar en la piel del protagonista.

Los personajes son [b]geniales[/b], bien construidos y sobretodo [b]psicolÃ³gicamente[/b] muy humanos, lo que hace fÃ¡cil entenderlos para poder llevar a cabo conversaciones realistas y sacarles pistas de forma natural.

Traduccion y doblaje: [u]10/10[/u] (Dado que la colaboracion es europea entre varios paises, se nota que no han dejado ninguna palabra al azar, no IA amÃ©n).

En resumen, aunque a continuaciÃ³n vas a leer algunas de mis pegas, no puedo quejarme en absoluto porque he terminado el tÃ­tulo esa ilusiÃ³n que ahora escasea en los videojuegos, buen sabor de boca, un pedazo de guiÃ³n que no me esperaba y todavÃ­a me deja pensando, pero sobretodo ganas de rejugarlo.

[b]10/10[/b]
Nada de nueves, la perfecciÃ³n es una idiotez y este juego se merece un diez.

[hr][/hr]

Lo [i]indecente[/i] del juego son detalles insignificantes como colisiones con objetos que se podrÃ­an pisar, algun bug molesto, zonas de atascamiento (frustrante) que tuve que me hicieron reiniciar el juego 4 veces.

El Ãºnico argumento [i]desfavorable[/i] para este titulo puede ser que cerca del final del juego en una cinematica en la que hay que presionar repetidas veces un boton tuve que recurrir a utilizar un autoclicker porque era inhumano la velocidad de pulsaciÃ³n, repetÃ­ la escena con el teclado, el mando, finalmente tuve que usar el autoclicker porque es imposible para mi (y no soy lento).

Compatibilidad: 100% he jugado en Debian 12 con Proton 9.0 y no tengo ningÃºn problema.

tags: Adventure, Detective, Choices Matter, Story Rich, Noir

Lo indecente del juego son detalles insignificantes como colisiones con objetos que se podrÃ­an pisar, algun bug molesto, zonas de atascamiento (frustrante) que tuve que me hicieron reiniciar el juego 4 veces.

El Ãºnico argumento desfavorable para este titulo puede ser que cerca del final del juego en una cinematica en la que hay que presionar repetidas veces un boton tuve que recurrir a utilizar un autoclicker porque era inhumano la velocidad de pulsaciÃ³n, repetÃ­ la escena con el teclado, el mando, finalmente tuve que usar el autoclicker porque es imposible para mi (y no soy lento).

Compatibilidad: 100% he jugado en Debian 12 con Proton 9.0 y no tengo ningÃºn problema.

review_text:
Nunca tuve tanta diversiÃ³n con un juego tan simple. El combate y los controles dejan mucho que desear, especialmente comparÃ¡ndolo con los juegos mÃ¡s modernos. Pero a pesar de estas fallas, el juego es muy entretenido.

-La historia es lo suficientemente interesante al comienzo como en el resto del juego.Â 
-La mÃºsica es muy buena y encaja bien en todas las escenas, dungeons y momentos del juego.Â 
-La exploraciÃ³n del juego es de lo mejor por la forma en que manejaron el sistema de habilidades. Casi ningun loot del juego es basura o inservible como en muchos RPGs modernos.
-Es bastante impresionante cÃ³mo manejaron los objetos claves y los acertijos del juego.Â 
-El mundo se siente vivo con los diÃ¡logos de los personajes cambiando y reaccionando a los eventos del juego y el mundo. Esto es algo que me encanta, ya que muchos juegos (en especial RPGs) dejaron de hacer esto.Â

review_text_clean:
Nunca tuve tanta diversiÃ³n con un juego tan simple. El combate y los controles dejan mucho que desear, especialmente comparÃ¡ndolo con los juegos mÃ¡s modernos. Pero a pesar de estas fallas, el juego es muy entretenido.

-La historia es lo suficientemente interesante al comienzo como en el resto del juego. 
-La mÃºsica es muy buena y encaja bien en todas las escenas, dungeons y momentos del juego. 
-La exploraciÃ³n del juego es de lo mejor por la forma en que manejaron el sistema de habilidades. Casi ningun loot del juego es basura o inservible como en muchos RPGs modernos.
-Es bastante impresionante cÃ³mo manejaron los objetos claves y los acertijos del juego. 
-El mundo se siente vivo con los diÃ¡logos de los personajes cambiando y reaccionando a los eventos del juego y el mundo. Esto es algo que me encanta, ya que muchos juegos (en especial RPGs) dejaron de hacer esto.

review_text:
Un buen plataformas indie donde eres un chico con el poder de controlar los cadÃ¡veres de tus enemigos.

El juego se basa en dos partes, la primera son las plataformas y el combate como el chico, y la segunda son los puzzles usando las diferentes abilidades de las criaturas que has matado. La primera parte deja que desear, ya que el combate es aburrido y se hace un poco tedioso cuando tienes que repetir un puzzle varias veces. La segunda es la parte divertida del juego, combinar las posesiones para poder abrirte paso por la mazmorra.

Le doy una recomendaciÃ³n, buenos puzzles necromÃ¡nticos, pero el combate anodino.

La segunda es la parte divertida del juego, combinar las posesiones para poder abrirte paso por la mazmorra.

Le doy una recomendaciÃ³n, buenos puzzles necromÃ¡nticos, pero el combate anodino.

review_text:
The main trump card of this game is the style. Thanks to it, you are well immersed in the era of the Cuban missile crisis. The graphics (although outdated) are pleasing to the eye. The downside of this game is that it is easy (personally, I easily completed the entire campaign) and there are few activities in the game itself (this was partially added in the subsequent parts)

A good game, I advise you to play it a little

For developers. I ask you to consider the possibility of creating a new Tropico 7 in the old, darker setting. The new parts are not particularly popular precisely because of the transition to a cartoonish, not serious setting. Try to create a strategy about a Caribbean dictator that is both complex and attractive in its setting. I hope everyone will support this proposal. Thank you.

review_text:
Tremendous arcade game!
Big plus in a game are beautiful views of megalopolises and very beautiful graphics which on an equal basis costs with such arcade monsters as Daytona USA and Scud Race

Early access prompts to me that very much it would be desirable to hope for bringing a game to perfection in respect of length of routes whenever possible to make route length in the manner of the game Need For Speed Hot Pursuit not to the detriment of graphics and infrastructure facilities, a variety of infrastructure on the route (various bridges, various tunnels, mountain canyons, serpentines) and one of the main tasks in my opinion it is necessary to finish accuracy management and behavior of the car on the road. it seemed to me in spite of the fact that it is an arcade game with tuning elements - the car very much too "rubber" behaves on the road.

In general a game has very much pleased! I thank developers for an excellent game!

review_text_clean: Las mecanicas arruinan el juego, la experiencia totalmente arruinada. Te genera fastidio en un punto y cuesta seguir jugando. No entiendo como esto fue jugado y probado y nadie se quejo.

review_text:
!!Schade eigentlich das es so vermasselt wird!!

Nachtteile:

Es entspricht absolut nicht dem was im Video gezeigt wird. Es sieht komplett schwammig aus. Die HÃ¤user sind alle leer. An den BÃ¤umen wachsen die Ã„ste aus der Luft raus. Kein LinkshÃ¤nder Support. Man hat keine Grafik Einstellungen. Soll ich noch mehr aufzÃ¤hlen? Ok die Zweihandwaffen kann man nur mit einer Hand nehmen. Das ziel Fernrohr funktioniert nur in einer unnatÃ¼rlichen haltung. Kein Voicechat zumindest hab ich nichts gehÃ¶rt. Sowas wie AtmosphÃ¤re kommt hier leider nicht auf. Im Zombie Modus kommt alles zuviel und zu schnell auf einen zu.

Desweiteren war es mir nicht mÃ¶glich irgendwas Ã¼ber den Entwickler oder Publisher rauszufinden.

Vorteile:
Das Loot System find ich super. Karte ist auch ganz cool.  Die Idee das die Toten wiedererweckt werden und als Zombies wiederkommen, das macht das Spielprinzip irgendwie aufregender. Oder Spawnen diese einfach zufÃ¤llig? Ganz verstanden hab ich das leider nicht. 


The participants are over !! It's a pity that it gets screwed up !!

Night parts:

It is absolutely not what is shown in the video. It looks completely spongy. The houses are all empty. The branches grow out of the air on the trees. No left-handed support. You have no graphics settings. Should I list more? Ok, the two-handed weapons can only be taken with one hand. The goal of telescope works only in an unnatural attitude. No voice chat at least I did not hear anything. Something like atmosphere does not come here unfortunately.

Furthermore, I was not able to find out anything about the developer or publisher.

Advantages:
The loot system is great. Card is also very cool. The idea that the dead are awakened and come back as zombies makes the gameplay more exciting. Or just spawn them by accident? I did not understand that completely.

review_text:
Auch nach Jahren des nachpatchens und integrierten Fanmods, die das Spiel spielbar machen, kann man es leider nicht guten Gewissens empfehlen.
Schon das Original war streng gnommen nichts weiter als ein ambitioniertes aber fehlgeschlagenes Projekt, denn auch nach damaligen Standarts waren viele Elemente des Spieles einfach nicht gut umgesetzt. So musste man z.B. GÃ¼rtel in der Hand tragen oder ganze Gamemechaniken, wie der Survival-Aspekt, waren schlicht nicht implementiert. Das konnte das Spiel auch mit gut erzÃ¤hlter Geschichte und nicht-linearitÃ¤t nur teilweise wett machen. Dann kam Sternenschweif und die Schucksalsklinge fÃ¼hrte ein Dasein als Level- und AusrÃ¼stungsort fÃ¼r die Sternenschweif-Party.
Dieses Spiel hatte die MÃ¶glichkeit das wett zu machen. Die fehler von damals ausbÃ¼geln, nette Grafik dazu, fertig. Stattdessen....
Zwar sind manche Fehler behoben, aber dazu soviele neue hinzugekommen! Heilen? Nur einmal am Tag bei der Rast. Und der Heiler darf auch nur einmal ran! Kampf-KI? Gegner drehen sich im Kreise. StÃ¤dte sind lebloser als im Original, da dort einfach nichts passiert und vieles mehr, was man an Kritik anbringen kÃ¶nnte. So manche Dinge, die man in diesem Spiel frustriert akzeptiert, wÃ¤ren in anderen Spielen Bugs, vor allem in den KÃ¤mpfen. Spielt die ersten zwei KÃ¤mpfe und ihr wisst, was ich meine...
Dennoch hÃ¤tte das Spiel ein "Neutral" von mir bekommen, wenn es das denn nun geben wÃ¼rde. Denn es ist eine Wiederbelebung eines Spieles, das mir trotz seiner Fehler am Herzen lag und liegt. Das durchaus auch StÃ¤rken hat. Den Sprecher z.B. (auch wenn er auf die Dauer durchaus nerven kann). Die Umsetzung von DSA 3 (dem Regelsystem, dass ich am meisten schÃ¤tze). Zudem hat mich das Spiel unter 5 Euro gekostet, so dass das Preis-LeistungsverhÃ¤ltnis nun stimmt.
Dennoch: erwartet ihr einen klassischen RPG-GenuÃŸ und seid keine Fans des Originals - last die Finger davon!

review_text:
Schicksalsklinge hat bei mir einen  Nostalgiebonus. Ich habe seinerzeit das P&P-Originl gespielt, dann Schatten Ã¼ber Riva und war sofort vertraut mit den Regeln. Ich hatte immmer wieder viel Ã¼ber Schicksalsklinge und Sternenschweif gelesen, es aber wegen der Grafik immer nur kurz angespielt. Bis ich dann das Remake im Laden sah und die Chance nutzen wollte, diesen Klassiker durchzuspielen. Es war damals die DVD-Version 1.2x. Diese habe ich schon ohne grÃ¶ÃŸere Bugs durchspielen kÃ¶nnen und habe da schon das Engagement des Teams mitbekommen, doch noch ein sehr gutes Produkt machen zu wollen. Ganz groÃŸes Lob dafÃ¼r!

Jetzt las ich, dass das Remake von Sternenschweif in der Mache ist und ich habe mir Schicksalsklinge nochmal auf Steam geholt um einen Spielstnd fÃ¼r Sternenschweif zu haben :)

Was soll ich zu den anderen teils umfangreichen Reviews hinzufÃ¼gen? Ich finde die Kampf-Avatare nicht soooo schlimm. Im Gegensatz zum Original finde ich die KÃ¤mpfe sogar wesentlich angenehmer mit zoomen und drehen. Die Story ist solala, wird aber durch die Umsetzung und Aufmachung wieder wettgemacht: das Rumreisen und Entdecken, die Ereignisse, die teilweise sehr zum Schmunzeln einladen, das Gruppenmanagement, der spitzenmÃ¤ÃŸige Sprecher usw. Bugs hatte ich keine mehr mit 1.36 und durch die Mods/DLC kommt noch mal viel Content und viele Features hinzu. 

Man sollte sich aber im Klaren sein, dass es wegen der GrÃ¶ÃŸe des Studios kein AAA-Titel (Grafik zB - nett und funktional aber halt nich weltspitze) ist. Auch ist die Lernkurve sehr steil und man sollte als Neuling bereit sein, viel zu lesen und zu lernen (KomplettlÃ¶sung per ModManager, Regelwerke usw.). DafÃ¼r wird man aber mit  einem einzigartigen Spielerlebnis belohnt. In welchem anderen RPG Ã¼berlegt man sonst noch, ob man es noch vor dem Winter schafft, den Bergpass zu passieren und ob man  genug SchlafsÃ¤cke hat :)?
  
Mir hat Schiksalsklinge HD sehr viel  Spass gemacht. FÃ¼r mich sind es 8 von 10 Punkten. Sternenschweif EA ist bestellt und sieht schon sehr gut aus mit sinnvollen ErgÃ¤nzungen und Verbesserungen - ich freue mich drauf :)

review_text:
ENG:

I love Sid meier's simgolf game but, compared this game into this game, this game is not fully complete game so, currently i can't recomented this game because, this game not have or still have all features that i wanted or looking for & game have lot of small bugs that not was fixed yet.

Most important or issue for this game is "game update schedules". When game was released this game get updates every week & then they planed to change this to make big patch that gonna released every month but, for now this is changed too dramatically for now their update has been delayed by more than 3 months, which usually should have come every month. This promise has not kept!

It is difficult to believe now or to know whether there will be next a new update or not. I still want these developers to have only a weekly update period instant of montly update. 

So it's hard to believe the game and the game makers anymore because the game lacks solid and active support.



FIN:

review_text:
Well, it looked promising, but ended up as gimmick.
Bland controls that are straight from 1980s/1990s without any tricks:
A - special move
X - attack
A+X - another special move
B - block
Y - grab
no jumping and jumping attacks.
Fights are just boring. In Final Fight you could perform jump attack in two ways: jump+attack OR jump+down+attack. Also you could grab and throw enemies or jump and hit them on the floor.
Music is great. But you'll get tired of the game quickly even in coop

name: Bud Spencer & Terence Hill - Slaps And Beans
tags: Beat 'em up, Action, Pixel Graphics, Retro, Arcade
review_text_clean:
Well, it looked promising, but ended up as gimmick.
Bland controls that are straight from 1980s/1990s without any tricks:
A - special move
X - attack
A+X - another special move
B - block
Y - grab
no jumping and jumping attacks.
Fights are just boring. In Final Fight you could perform jump attack in two ways: jump+attack OR jump+down+attack. Also you could grab and throw enemies or jump and hit them on the floor.
Music is great. But you'll get tired of the game quickly even in coop
===

PLEASE REFUND THE COST OF THIS GAME.

review_text:
[u]English version :[/u]
Firstly I want to state that I hate writing a negative review. 
However, though it's not a bad game if you enjoy Hercules-like games, [b][i]Lost Artifacts - Ancient Tribe Survival[/i][/b] suffers from a unforgivable glitch if you played the game since its release. The [b]"Champion" achievement[/b] (=collecting all trophies) is broken on Steam, even though it perfectly works in-game.  
To me it's not a reason serious enough to put a thumb down to a game and my only reason to be that disappointed today is the lack of appropriate answer from the dev team members to all the gamers who bought their game and who are complaining about this on a discussion thread..
[strike]I don't know if the developpers are aware of that discussion topic. A dozen of gamers or so have reported this bug and have been waiting for weeks for some kind of fix or at least an answer from dev team.. but nothing, as if the developpers didn't care.[/strike]
I bought [b][i]Lost Artifacts - Ancient Tribe Survival[/i][/b] as soon as it was released with no hesitation only because I did enjoy a games serie from the same team. 
If the team keeps on remaining silent about that achievement related bug I know I'll pass on their next games, at least untill I've had some feedbacks. [b]That's not a big deal since there are a lot of games of that kind out there on the Steam store, whose achievements are unlocking correctly.[/b]

Apart from that specific point, if you are not an achievement hunter and don't care about those, then [b][i]Lost Artifacts - Ancient Tribe Survival[/i][/b] is a casual game, somewhat enjoyable. 


[b]EDIT : I've just noticed that there seems to be a developper's answer on the mentionned thread like 2 weeks ago. Now let's wait and see..[/b]

[b][u]2nd EDIT : Weeks later..[/u]
There's been an update! "Hurray" would you think? Well.. actually, forget about it !!  Launched the game, replayed a couple of levels but [i]"Champion" achievement[/i] still won't unlock on Steam. Dunno if we are supposed to create another profile and give the whole game another playthrough. I don't know and I don't think I'm gonna try. I'm tired of all this. I will just forget about both the developper and the publisher for their lack of reliability and I will never ever buy one of their games. 
[/b]




[u]French/franÃ§ais :[/u]

Cependant, alors mÃªme que ce n'est pas un mauvais jeu dans le genre "Hercules", [b][i]Lost Artifacts - Ancient Tribe Survival[/i][/b] souffre d'un problÃ¨me intolÃ©rable si vous avez jouÃ© le jeu peu de temps aprÃ¨s sa mise en vente sur le Steam store : le succÃ¨s "Champion" (=ramasser tous les trophÃ©es) ne fonctionne pas sur Steam alors qu'il marche dans le jeu.

name: Lost Artifacts - Ancient Tribe Survival
genres: Action, Adventure, Casual, Indie, Simulation, Strategy
tags: Casual, Strategy, Management, Action, Adventure
review_text_clean:
English version : 
Firstly I want to state that I hate writing a negative review. 
However, though it's not a bad game if you enjoy Hercules-like games, Lost Artifacts - Ancient Tribe Survival suffers from a unforgivable glitch if you played the game since its release. The "Champion" achievement (=collecting all trophies) is broken on Steam, even though it perfectly works in-game. 
To me it's not a reason serious enough to put a thumb down to a game and my only reason to be that disappointed today is the lack of appropriate answer from the dev team members to all the gamers who bought their game and who are complaining about this on a discussion thread.
 I don't know if the developpers are aware of that discussion topic. A dozen of gamers or so have reported this bug and have been waiting for weeks for some kind of fix or at least an answer from dev team. but nothing, as if the developpers didn't care. 
I bought Lost Artifacts - Ancient Tribe Survival as soon as it was released with no hesitation only because I did enjoy a games serie from the same team. 
If the team keeps on remaining silent about that achievement related bug I know I'll pass on their next games, at least untill I've had some feedbacks. That's not a big deal since there are a lot of games of that kind out there on the Steam store, whose achievements are unlocking correctly. 

Apart from that specific point, if you are not an achievement hunter and don't care about those, then Lost Artifacts - Ancient Tribe Survival is a casual game, somewhat enjoyable. 


 EDIT : I've just noticed that there seems to be a developper's answer on the mentionned thread like 2 weeks ago. Now let's wait and see. 

 2nd EDIT : Weeks later. 
There's been an update! "Hurray" would you think? Well. actually, forget about it ! Launched the game, replayed a couple of levels but "Champion" achievement still won't unlock on Steam. Dunno if we are supposed to create another profile and give the whole game another playthrough. I don't know and I don't think I'm gonna try. I'm tired of all this. I will just forget about both the developper and the publisher for their lack of reliability and I will never ever buy one of their games.

review_text:
Might change opinion about the game later, but the first impression is not good. The first level has you navigating narrow bridges, literally from the start, and you die if you fall in water. There are no options to turn on invisible walls or any other accessibility features. For a small child (who I presume is the target demographic of a game about a cute little elephant going on an adventure), who is not yet that precise with the controls, this is insurmountable obstacle. They go forward a bit, try to turn a corner, fall in water and have to start from the beginning. Repeat until no one is having fun.

review_text:
Computer Gaming World named this the 34th worst game ever made? lol First of all, gaming mainstream media sucks. Yeah, they are terrible reviewers. IGN, GameSpot, other critics that appear on Metacritic, all of them, I don't like or follow them. Computer Gaming World is today a defunct 80s/90s magazine which I never read because I live in Brazil, but here we had similar ones which reviews sucked and they are all dead by now too. I played a lot of Pizza Tycoon back in my teenage years; I was still a toddler by its time, so I played it in the late 2000s/early 2010s along another nice old game called MadTV.

Let's not be anachronistic here: in 1994, this was a great game for MS-DOS, a classic today, even a masterpiece as much as SimCity is if you ask me so. It's fun, difficult, complex, had decent graphics for MS-DOS, it's too robust for its time, just don't believe the mass media, that's it. Also, there is nothing wrong if Steam sells it as Pizza Connection by Assemble and when you start it's labelled Pizza Tycoon by MicroProse and Cybernetic. If you do a proper research, you'll find out it's the same game, but Cybernetic was the developer which originally released it in Europe with Software 2000 as Pizza Connection, MicroProse was the USA distributor that modified the name and which version was eventually spread worldwide, and Assemble is the current rights owned and used the MicroProse version along the original title.

Most of my review is a response to a popular negative comment made here, but I also gave my opinion. One issue is true, though: this Steam version is buggy and will often crash DOSBox on Linux, still got my CD anyway. Despite that, my rating goes for the game itself.
[h3][b] Verdict: Great and fun game for its time, nostalgic for me [/b][/h3]
[h3][b] Linux: Runs on DOSBox, I recommend to use Boxtron [/b][/h3]

---------------------------------

Se fizer uma pesquisa adequada, descobrirÃ¡ que se trata do mesmo jogo, mas a Cybernetic era a desenvolvedora que originalmente o lanÃ§ou na Europa com a Software 2000 como Pizza Connection, a MicroProse era a distribuidora estadunidense que alterou o nome e esta versÃ£o que foi eventualmente espalhada mundialmente, e a Assemble Ã© a atual detentora dos direitos e usou a versÃ£o da MicroProse com o nome original.

English rewiev:

I hate math. Seeing this game, I realized that this is not my game. However, as it is cheap I bought her to me for a joke. I've been tightened. Round after round.....harder.....more and more interesting.....

The essence of the game is very simple and at the same time, the game makes a quick read and think.

There is a thermometer in the right part of the screen and a lot chaotically changing numbers, multiplications and other things on the screen. You need to collect a few times you want the number until a thermometer is not overheated. Every good number cools the thermometer.

In the game a relaxing and thought-provoking, sauntrek and I like it

Who loves math and relaxing puzzle will appreciate this game

review_text:
Very nice idea! The game is very lovingly and detailed designed. The graphic is wonderful! The idea is excellently worked out for VR - the orientation in the room works excellently, the playing field has a pleasant size. The core mechanics - the throw - is implemented great and works great! 

[Only problem: With me (Rift S) there are always problems with letting go when throwing - but in my experience this is due to the sensors in the switch of the TouchController. If you remove the cover of the batteries, which close magnetically, the error is fixed. If someone with Rift S has problems throwing: just play without the battery cover.]

Update: last time I checked, the problem was gone, even with magnetic covers attached!


Deutsch:
Sehr schÃ¶n umgesetzte Idee! Das Spiel ist sehr liebevoll und detailreich gestaltet. Die Grafik ist wunderbar! Die Idee ist hervorragend fÃ¼r VR ausgearbeitet - die Orientierung im Raum klappt hervorragend, das Spielfeld hat eine angenehme GrÃ¶ÃŸe. Die Kernmechanik - der Wurf - ist toll implementiert und klappt super! 

[Einziges Problem: Bei mir (Rift S) gibt es immer wieder Probleme mit dem Loslassen bei WÃ¼rfen - das liegt allerdings meiner Erfahrung nach an den Sensoren im Schalter des TouchControllers. Nimmt man die Abdeckung der Batterien ab, die ja magnetisch verschlieÃŸen, dann ist der Fehler behoben. Sollte jemand mit Rift S Probleme beim Wurf haben: einfach mal ohne Batterieabdeckung spielen.]

Update: Bei den letzten Spielen war das Problem verschwunden, selbst mit magnetischer Verdeckung.

review_text:
*DE unten

Okay where do i start?
The game is not very good in my opinion. Maybe I don't get it right, but if I do, I definitely advise against playing it. You have symbols that you have to arrange in the right order. It's called password hacking in game. However, it is completely random which symbols to choose and in which order. With a bit of luck you've made it and get to the next level. review_text:
English review / Evaluation franÃ§aise

*** English ***
Very little game, very bad one too.
6 levels, that's all you got, and, except the last one, they are pretty small.
The graphics are nice, aaand that's the only good thing about this game.
They use brands in-game, that they probably don't have a licence to (like Pepsi), the characters are Lego's rip-off, or look-a-like, and are the only (badly) animated stuff. Vehicules are static on the road, even if you can hear them moving, each level only has one soundtrack (the 5th level is a pain)...
While the graphics are nice, like previously stated, the objects you have to find are "drawn", so sometimes you don't even know what you are looking for, either because it's badly drawn, or because it's too small.
On open levels, it's easy to find a lot of things without checking the list, the game being so poorly detailed, one you see something popping-out, you might just click on it, because it's surely something you'll have to find.
There is also some pretty nonsense, like finding a shoe in a computer case, or vegetables in a dressing (those are example, to avoid spoilers).
Roughly 1h of playtime.

Would recommand playing [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/435400/Hidden_Folks/]Hidden Folks[/url] instead. Yes, it is more expensive, but you can get it at a fairly price during a sale.

*** FranÃ§ais ***
TrÃ¨s petit jeu, et trÃ¨s mauvais.
6 niveaux, qui, Ã  part le dernier, sont trÃ¨s petits, et c'est tout.
Les graphiques sont corrects, et voilÃ , c'est tout ce qu'il y a de bien dans ce jeu.
Des marques sont utilisÃ©es en jeu, pour lesquelles il n'y a certainement pas de licence (Pepsi, par exemple), les personnages sont des Lego, et sont les seules choses animÃ©es, et mal animÃ©es d'ailleurs. Les vÃ©hicules sont statiques sur la route, mÃªme si on peut les entendre bouger, chaque niveau n'a qu'une bande sonore (et le 5e fait mal)...
Alors que les graphismes sont corrects, comme dÃ©jÃ  dit, les objets Ã  trouver sont "dessinÃ©s", donc parfois on ne sait mÃªme pas ce que l'on cherche, soit parce qu'ils sont mal dessinÃ©s, soit parce que trop petits.
Dans les niveaux ouverts, il est facile de trouver des objets sans regarder la liste, car puisque les niveaux sont si peu dÃ©taillÃ©s, si vous voyez quelque-chose vous sauter aux yeux, vous feriez aussi bien de cliquer dessus , puisque c'est certainement quelque-chose qu'il faudra trouver.
Il y a aussi certaines choses qui n'ont ni queue ni tÃªte, comme trouver une chaussure dans une unitÃ© centrale, ou des lÃ©gumes dans une penderie (ce sont des exemples, pour Ã©viter le divulgÃ¢chage).
Environ 1h de jeu.

Je recommanderai [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/435400/Hidden_Folks/]Hidden Folks[/url] Ã  la place. Certes, le jeu est plus cher, mais il est possible de l'avoir Ã  un bon prix lorsqu'il a un rabais.

I have no idea how, but i made this buggy lvl possible to complete.
Theories about complition: 1-Right before you enter a 'bunker' when all textures get messy, to the right you can see some kind of generetors (or just long brown boxes?). When i tried retry the whole lvl wihout even getting close to them, textures start to behave normaly . 2- I saved right before entering undergroudn, while all textures down there were ok. After some retries whole section became visible .

review_text: Sufri este mal juego de principio a fin por lo genial que me parecia el 1. Pero este no le llega ni a los talones, la historia, debil y predecible, los puzzles no son muy atrayentes ni particularmente originales (aunque debo admitir que son increiblemente realistas, quizas demasiado). Pero el gran enemigo de este juego es la camara, que se mueve acompaÃ±ando al jugador, que molesta mas de lo que ayuda, y las colisiones. Podemos chocarnos con un objeto que ni siquiera vemos (culpa de la camara), esto no seria particularmente grave de no ser porque de repente salen escenas en las que podemos morir, casi de la nada, y que ademas que debemos resolver en momentos sin ayuda y sin guias, tambien debemos pelearnos con la camara, que no ayuda en la emergencia. Apenas si cumple al informarnos (de mala manera) que paso con la trama del 1.
name: Still Life 2
tags: Adventure, Point & Click, Female Protagonist, Crime, Mystery

review_text:
App suppose to multichat on Twitch, YouTube and TikTok. Last one doesn't work for a few months, and it was the only reason I bought it. Also I miss feature to auto-hide deleted messages, I have to delete them manually in SheepChat. Also app doesn't have any support and developer rarely responds to complaints.

review_text: Absolutamente recomendado. NO THING es un juego totalmente accesible a cualquier tipo de jugador. No importa cuÃ¡nta experiencia tengas, la premisa es muy simple: girar a la izquierda o a la derecha segÃºn lo indique el camino. El juego es sÃ³lo eso, pero por sencillo que suene, es mucho mÃ¡s complejo de lo que parece. Cada giro aumenta la velocidad a la que se desplaza el jugador. Cada cinco giros, cambia el color de la pantalla. Cuando el narrador llega a algunos puntos de su discurso, el mapa puede cambiar desde detalles mÃ­nimos como las imÃ¡genes de fondo, hasta el formato propio de la pista. Un juego sencillamente adictivo y atrapante.
